question.text:
Match the columns given below correctly.
 
Types of Wood Description
1. Early wood i. Has narrow vessels.
2. Late wood ii. Dead elements with highly lignified walls.
3. Heartwood iii. Vessels with wider cavities.
4. Sapwood iv. Lighter in colour.

options.text: <math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>.</mo></math>

<math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math> .

<math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>2</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math> .

solution.text: Heartwood does not conduct water or transport it but it is hard and gives plant mechanical support and thus consist of dead elements with lignified walls. Early wood or Spring wood is formed during spring season and known to have wide vessels  and Late wood have narrow vessels and cambium is less active in it. Sapwood is a part of secondary xylem in peripheral region which is lighter in colour.
